D1.label: Gold Price Leverage
D1.description: Horizon Minerals Limited executes on growth strategy; earnings accelerate
D1.plain_english: As a pre-production developer, HRZ offers significant operational leverage to the gold price. With AUD gold at historically elevated levels above A$4,000/oz, Boorara economics improve materially. Each A$100/oz move in AUD gold has an outsized impact on project NPV and per-ounce valuation multiples for developers.
D1.what_to_watch: Next earnings result and forward guidance.
D1.upside: Material re-rating if execution surprises to the upside.
D1.risk_plain: If growth disappoints, this narrative weakens.

D2.label: Production Transition
D2.description: Horizon Minerals Limited delivers steady-state results; valuation holds
D2.plain_english: The transition from developer to producer at Boorara is the single biggest re-rating catalyst. Kalgoorlie has multiple operating processing plants for toll treatment, reducing upfront capital vs standalone builds. First gold would transform HRZ from developer (~A$500-600/resource oz) to producer multiples (~A$800-1,500/oz).
D2.upside: See research report for upside scenario detail.
D2.risk_plain: If the base case is already priced in, limited upside from here.

D3.label: Funding & Dilution Risk
D3.description: Horizon Minerals Limited faces headwinds; earnings or multiples compress
D3.plain_english: As a pre-revenue company, Horizon burns cash quarterly on exploration, development, and corporate costs. Additional equity raises are highly likely before first production, potentially diluting existing shareholders. At A$256M market cap, a meaningful capital raise could compress the share price.
D3.what_to_watch: Cost pressures, competitive threats, or macro headwinds.
D3.risk_plain: Material downside if multiple risks crystallise simultaneously.

D4.label: Gold Price Reversal
D4.description: A structural shift changes the investment case for Horizon Minerals Limited
D4.plain_english: A sustained gold price decline below A$3,000/oz AUD would compress Boorara project economics and trigger a severe share price correction. Pre-production developers are the most leveraged to gold price moves in both directions.
D4.what_to_watch: Industry disruption signals and regulatory changes.
D4.risk_plain: If disruption materialises, prior assumptions become invalid.

big_picture: Horizon Minerals is a near-term gold developer in the prolific Kalgoorlie Goldfields, trading at A$1.24 with a ~500koz resource base. The stock has re-rated +94% from its 52-week low, reflecting gold price strength and Boorara development progress. The capital-light toll treatment strategy reduces execution risk, but funding and dilution remain key risks for a pre-revenue company.

commodity_overlay.breakeven_note: HRZ is pre-production. AISC is estimated from DFS. Actual costs unknown until first pour.
commodity_overlay.secondary_note: AUD weakness amplifies gold tailwind for AUD-cost producer
commodity_overlay.sensitivity: +A$100/oz gold ≈ significant FCF uplift (pre-production — sensitivity estimate only)
